name: potassium nitrate production, agricultural grade | potassium nitrate, agricultural grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20955/documentation

This activity represents the production of potassium nitrate in a purity of 50%. This potassium nitrate (KNO3) is chlorine-free, water soluble, and shows fast absorption for agricultural use. The chemical production process of potassium nitrates (KNO3) goes via sodium nitrate (NaO3) extracted from the caliche ore and potassium chloride (KCl) harvested from the Salar brines.

The activity involves a nitrate crystallization process at moderate temperatures (80Â°C) to form KNO3 from NaNO3 and KCL.

The activity ends with the potassium nitrate ready for use at a purity of 50%.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Process data provided are from 2014/2015 and are valid for today's and near future production at SQM in Chile.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The production facilitiy is located in the Atacama Desert in northern Chile where the chemical is produced by the global producer and supplier SQM.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: SQM continueously improves this process to increase production volume and its efficiency.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data have been provided by the producer SQM in Chile.  SQM is a global producer and supplier of plant nutrients, iodine, lithium and industrial chemicals. The production facilities are located in the Atacama Desert where the chemicals are produced from natural resources via mining, crystalization and refining processes. Initially, some data and process information has been exchanged via questionaires. Further, more specific data were provided via intensive direct contact with experts at SQM.
